title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments:
**Are you looking for small gig work - writing blog posts and reviews?**

I am looking to engage bloggers and writers for a small project   


* Freelancers with background in book editing and book reviews 
* Bloggers who are social media savvy  


&#x200B;

DM me with your profile and rate and we can chat further

Hiring for multiple roles: 

Sales/BDO, ReactJS, React Native 

For a Product based SaaS

Contact at anuj [@] goaffpro.com

Looking to get hired:

Semi-Qualified Cost and Management Accountant with 2 years of professional working experience in Accounts Payable process, as a Finance Trainee, in Indian Oil Corporation Limited and Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited.

Hands on experience with SAP FICO module, WrenchENT Client (a DBMS tool), Ramco systems modules (ERP Software), and MS Office (Excel and Word).

Location: Delhi NCR (WFH/WFO/Full Time/Part Time)

Please DM me If you have any work opportunities related to my work experience and skills. I'll also share my LinkedIn profile, if it helps to know more about me. And if it's something which is not from my background, we can discuss it together to see wheather I'm the right fit for it. 

Thank you.

PS: Also, please let me know If anyone is willing to take a look at my resume to provide some suggestions. It would be a huge help.

Looking for remote content writing opportunities. I used to do freelance writing a long time back in the gadgets and tech niche but switched careers. I love writing and doing researching on topics so I sort of want to get backs into the field again.  I have a masters in counselling psychology now and worked for a few years as a counsellor and in training people in basic counselling skills.  My main occupation now is my role as violinist private/violin tutor. I also game and can write gaming reviews/news.  

 Hereâ€™s a review I wrote recently: 

https://goodgamereviews4u.wordpress.com/2022/11/16/plague-tale-review/
Looking for remote FPnA opportunities. Having 2 years of experience in MNC in revenue and financial, planning and analysis profile.

**Global Tech company(Micro Focus) has massive job opportunities in India  (better with at least 2+ years experience) (most in Bangalore)**

I'm an internal employee, If you are interested Please send your resume to [yanghua.hu@microfocus.com](mailto:yanghua.hu@microfocus.com), I can refer you and guide you.

&#x200B;

\#### The jobs are:  
\- Java/C/C++/Python/Front-End Engineer  
\- QA Engineer  
\- Senior Angular/Java Engineer  
\- Cyber Security Engineer  
\- Devops  
\- R&D Manager  
\- HR System Engineer
Can you clarify what you mean by FPna opportunities?

Looking to get hired :

1.Mbbs graduate in 2 months 
2. Tele Medical service 
3. Freelance voice over
4. Word to pdf 
5. Hindi / Telugu / English translation 
6. Data entry
7.Abacus tutor 

Location : vijayawada 

Please dm if youâ€™ve any openings

Guys Iâ€™m a business consultant with a world leading tech company, have done my mba from an old iim and my grad from an old nift. I have over 12 years experience and I manage about 700 people in India and Europe. I am qualified to give career counselling to people of all age group and career stages in fashion, retail, e-commerce, and tech. Let me know if someone is in need.
No charge and no names, of course.

After barely managing to graduate in engineering, I decided to pursue a masters degree in mass communication from Delhi, but an overview of the unregulated and unstructured manner of the industry has drained my creative interests which had made me opt for a communications degree in the first place. I simply want to earn for the sake of making ends meet.

I am confused whether to start preparing for SSC exams, or if I should take up a software training course as Indian market seems to be able to support only IT jobs.

I am stuck and any kind of guidance or opinion would be appreciated.

Just google freecodecamp & fullstackopen, click on the first links and go through the all study material, check if it interests you and if it does, complete studying it consistently. If you're able to do this, you're already in top 1 percentile of IT, atleast knowledge wise. Rest depends on your merit and bit of luck. Good luck.
Abacus tutor? So cool!

Looking to get hired : date, you can hire me to come along with you to wherever you want me as a date. Iâ€™ll just be sitting or moving along with you and I do nothing. I donâ€™t talk I just listen, I want my mula at the end of the day.
Thanks for this. I'll email you my CV.
150 rupiya dega
Let's go, tell me where to come.
P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney
Okay but ill accept only cash so make sure you have them ready in Australia. I'll book my flight, I might be late an hour or so keep in mind.
we go under ocean. finding nemo style
Sweet.

Looking to get hired

Your skillset/experience: AI/ML Developer, ~2 years experience

Location: India

Preferred way of contacting me: Public link to job application / DM
Itâ€™s cool , but didnâ€™t find anyone interested in abacus to tutor ðŸ˜„

I'm a Data Engineer trying to figure out career direction.

How did you get into AI/ML? Do you have a PhD? Did you do Data Science before?

I did a PG diploma course.

What kind of tasks does data engineer have?

I think DE responsibilities vary slightly by company, but this is what I currently do:

* create and maintain cloud data infrastructure as needed 
* create data pipelines to serve BI and DS/AI/ML teams
* maintain data lake and data warehouse
* I also jump in as BI dev when the BI team is overloaded

I started as a BI dev and switched into DE. Trying to figure out next career moves. One thing I am potentially looking into is getting into big data positions internally at my company
Can I do a full time and contract job at same time?
Hey, should I PM you?
Financial planning and analysis
I completed MCA but have no experience, since I built blogs and websites to earn from affiliate marketing. How easy is it to get job in my condition?
Should I PM you??
Yeah sure
Go ahead!
Create a portfolio, showcase your work. If it doesnâ€™t work, upskill with relevant certifications
jyotishkumar.artstation.com

Need career guidance. I am 30F residing in India, currently working for a Big4 in Government consulting. In 7 years of work ex I've held different job roles but Government was mostly part of it, directly or indirectly and I finally gave in to a corporate role. 

I have a bachelors in masters in social sciences and at the 6 year work ex mark decided to pursue an MBA just to move abroad. Recently however I started attending a ceramics class on the side and absolutely loved the entire process it requires. I'm beginning to think I need to have a more creative hands-on role and am having second-thoughts about my MBA goal. However, belonging to a middle class family where I need to support my parents as well, I'm not sure how to solve my confusion and plan my next year. One part of me wants to stay here, pursue ceramics with my full time job and commit to living in this city and another part of me wants to go abroad to pursue the MBA and settle there. 

Not looking at public policy or similar course because it would box me in this sector that I'm getting very tired and disillusioned with. I thought MBA would be a good and comfortable out for me and I'm confident of securing admission in a decent school. My wavering commitment is however delaying the process for me. Is there a way I can directly apply for a job in Europe in Government related sectors for now and pursue my creative dreams on the side from there?
